intro: Lappula scaberrima, commonly known as rough lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, ribbed stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Lappula scaberrima is known for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
